fields.name: Rivers
fields.description: The rivers layer displays the major rivers and water bodies across South Africa. This layer is useful for understanding the hydrography of the region.

fields.name: Roads
fields.description: The roads layer provides information about the road network in South Africa. It can be valuable for assessing how transportation infrastructure impacts species distribution and conservation efforts.

fields.name: Biome type
fields.description: The biome type layer illustrates the various biomes and ecosystems in South Africa. This layer is essential for understanding the different habitats where species are found.

fields.name: Critical Biodiversity areas
fields.description: The critical biodiversity areas layer highlights regions of significant ecological importance and high species diversity. It aids in identifying key areas for conservation efforts.

fields.name: Protected areas
fields.description: The protected areas layer displays locations of nature reserves, parks, and conservation areas. It's essential for identifying regions where species are under protection.

fields.name: Cadastral boundaries
fields.description: The cadastral boundaries layer outlines property boundaries and land divisions. It can be valuable for understanding land ownership and land use in relation to species habitats.

fields.name: Place names
fields.description: The place names layer provides information on geographic place names and locations across South Africa. It helps users identify specific locations for their research or exploration.

fields.name: Properties
fields.description: The properties layer displays information about properties or land parcels. Users can explore land attributes, ownership, and potential impacts on species populations.

fields.name: NGI Aerial Imagery
fields.description: The NGI Aerial Imagery layer provides high-resolution aerial imagery of South Africa. It is valuable for visualising the landscape and habitats in detail.
